job_title: Mechanical/Mechatronics Engineer or Engineering Physics Student
job_description: Mechanical/Mechatronics Engineer or Engineering Physics StudentHydroRun Technologies Ltd. is developing the HydroKite™, a new system that produces clean, renewable electricity from rivers, without the need for dams or diversions. We're looking for talented, driven individuals who like technology and a challenge to join our team.About the PositionsWorking in a small tech company means your week could involve a bit of anything. Everyone does the jobs that need to be done. The focus of this position though is working with our exceptional engineers to help fabricate and test the 3m, 450kg, underwater robotic kite.Our co-op students work on integral aspects of the HydroKite™ system. You'll gain a diverse range of skills you never even considered, as well as hone the ones your degree is focusing on. By the end of your term you'll have become a better engineer and a company expert in at least one subject or aspect of our project.We believe that fit within the team, personality, resourcefulness and drive are the most important qualities in a HydroRun employee.Location: This position is located at our workshop in central Burnaby. Transport for field testing is provided by the company.Duration: 4, 8, or 12 months.Duties may include: Testing of the HydroKite™ at our field site on the Fraser River Data analysis of test data Design and fabrication of experimental apparatus and instrumentation Aiding engineers with the design and operation of HydroKite™ componentsAbout HydroRunHydroRun was founded in 2012 to commercialize the HydroKite™, which is being developed by a team of young and exceptionally talented engineers redefining the integration of robotics, controls, optimization of underwater vessels and power generation.The company is financed by Canadian and International capital management funds and is directed by a board with over 100 years of business and energy experience.For more information, please see our website: www.hydrorun.ca
job_requirements: Desired Skills: Curious, self-directed, and takes the initiative Experience with CNC and manual manufacture Proficiency with Solidworks and AutoCAD Experience with hand tools Experience in the marine or river environment Programming ability C/C++ and/or Python Soldering and circuit assembly Data Analysis Knowledge of fluid mechanics Control systems Comfortable around water, and being outside in all weather conditionsOpen To All Majors:No
